text: Eric Francis Wieschaus (born June 8, 1947) is an American developmental biologist. A lot of Wieschaus' research focuses on embryogenesis in the fruit fly Drosophila melanogaster and it specifically focuses on the patterning which occurs in the early Drosophila embryo. In 1995, Wieschaus shared the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with Edward B. Lewis and Christiane NÃ¼sslein-Volhard "for their discoveries concerning the genetic control of early embryonic development". ==References== Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:American geneticists Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:American developmental biologists Category:Scientists from Indiana Category:Yale University alumni Category:People from South Bend, Indiana
title: Eric F. Wieschaus
